name: Sildenafil (Viagra)
description: Effective oral medication for erectile dysfunction. Fast-acting with shorter half-life than tadalafil.

name: Tadalafil (Cialis)
description: Long-acting ED treatment, often preferred for its ~36-hour window.

name: Finasteride (Propecia)
description: Blocks DHT to slow or reverse male pattern hair loss.

name: Minoxidil
description: Topical treatment that stimulates hair follicles and promotes growth.

name: Semaglutide (Ozempic, Wegovy)
description: GLP-1 receptor agonist originally for diabetes, now widely used for weight loss.

name: Tirzepatide (Mounjaro)
description: Dual GLP-1/GIP receptor agonist for diabetes and weight loss.

name: SSRIs/SNRIs
description: Includes sertraline, fluoxetine, escitalopram, and venlafaxine — widely prescribed antidepressants.

name: Bupropion
description: Antidepressant also used for smoking cessation; fewer sexual side effects than SSRIs.

name: Propranolol
description: Beta-blocker sometimes prescribed for performance anxiety.

name: Oral Contraceptives
description: Combination pills widely used for birth control and menstrual regulation.

name: Emergency Contraception
description: Emergency birth control pill to prevent pregnancy after unprotected sex.

name: Spironolactone
description: Used for PCOS and acne due to anti-androgen effects.

name: Trazodone
description: Low-dose antidepressant often prescribed for insomnia.

name: Melatonin
description: Over-the-counter supplement to regulate circadian rhythm.

name: Low-dose Doxepin
description: Tricyclic antidepressant in microdoses for insomnia relief.

name: Modafinil
description: Wakefulness-promoting drug sometimes used off-label for focus.

name: Testosterone
description: Prescribed for hypogonadism in men; also misused for performance and longevity.

name: Estrogen / Progesterone
description: Used in women’s HRT, especially around menopause.

name: Adderall (Mixed Amphetamine Salts)
description: Common ADHD medication, tightly regulated due to abuse potential.

name: Ritalin (Methylphenidate)
description: ADHD treatment; shorter half-life than Adderall.

name: Vyvanse (Lisdexamfetamine)
description: Long-acting ADHD medication with lower abuse risk.

name: Xanax (Alprazolam)
description: Rapid-acting benzodiazepine for anxiety; high abuse risk.

name: Ativan (Lorazepam)
description: Used for acute anxiety and panic attacks; addictive potential.

name: Klonopin (Clonazepam)
description: Prescribed for seizures and anxiety; high dependence risk.

name: Ketamine
description: Used in controlled therapeutic settings for depression and anxiety.
